pullRequest.body:
This file introduces the Sylvester's sequence. This is sequence [A000058](https://oeis.org/A000058) in OEIS. In this PR we define the sequence, prove basic facts, and its pairwise coprimality. 

The goal is proving a explicit non-recursive formula in a following PR (in this [branch](/leanprover-community/mathlib4/tree/special-numbers/sylvester-explicit), PR #21244 ).

Initial discussion in [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/113489-new-members/topic/Formalizing.20Special.20Numbers.20from.20Concrete.20Mathematics).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: messageFile.md

Is seems like Sylvester's sequence (without the leading 1) is a bit more natural (it has a nicer definition, and nicer formulas, and seems to be the one that people study). Would it make more sense to formalize that instead?
Thank you for the comment and for reviewing! We'll work on implementing the Sylvester sequence definition (without the leading 1)
Hi @tb65536, we've updated the PR to now have a file Sylverster.lean that implements the sequence definition without the leading 1. Please take a look and let us know what feedback you have. Thanks!
messageFile.md
Should we update the title and description of the PR to reflect that it introduces the Sylvester's sequence instead of the Euclid numbers? Or would it break the workflow of the PR?

> Should we update the title and description of the PR to reflect that it introduces the Sylvester's sequence instead of the Euclid numbers? Or would it break the workflow of the PR?

Yes, you should update those. It won't cause any problems.
messageFile.md
messageFile.md
I also updated the comments and the title to say "Sylvester's sequence", so it matches the name from OEIS.
messageFile.md

Thank you for approving, @tb65536 ! I was reading https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html#lifecycle-of-a-pr and I'm not sure of the next step. Is there something else for us to do? Or the PR lifecycle continues automatically?

> Thank you for approving, @tb65536 ! I was reading https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html#lifecycle-of-a-pr and I'm not sure of the next step. Is there something else for us to do? Or the PR lifecycle continues automatically?

Basically, the PR is looking good to me, but I think it would be helpful to have another pair of eyes look over it. This will happen automatically (eventually).
Thank you @tb65536. We'll be happy to address new comments.
messageFile.md
Also, please merge master to stop the silly bot messages above!

> Thanks!
> 
> Could you include in the PR description an explanation of what you're working towards here? I don't think mathlib can justify having every OEIS sequence at this point, but if this is a step towards something else I think this is reasonable to add.

We started formalizing some simple facts from the chapter Special Numbers from Knuth's Concrete Mathematics, as a learning process, and we thought the explicit formula for what Knuth called the Euclid numbers was a small self-contained result.  We got the suggestion to create the PR from a conversation in [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/113489-new-members/topic/Formalizing.20Special.20Numbers.20from.20Concrete.20Mathematics).

The PR #21244 is the continuation of this one. I'll update the description to make it more explicit.

### PR summary [6300ca3c87](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20669/commits/6300ca3c871bb6503cb6a3590a8fb780ea1b27c7)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.Sylvester` (new file)|1328|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ sylvesterSequence`
`+ sylvester_coprime`
`+ sylvester_mod_eq_one`
`+ sylvester_one`
`+ sylvester_prod_finset_add_one`
`+ sylvester_strictMono`
`+ sylvester_three`
`+ sylvester_two`
`+ sylvester_zero`
`+ two_le_sylvester`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

> Also, please merge master to stop the silly bot messages above!

Oh! That's the reason of the `messageFile.md`. I was going to ask in Zulip about that. Thank you very much.

> from a conversation in [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/113489-new-members/topic/Formalizing.20Special.20Numbers.20from.20Concrete.20Mathematics).
> 
> The PR #21244 is the continuation of this one. I'll update the description to make it more explicit.

Thanks! In general, if a PR was inspired by a Zulip discussion, it's always a good idea to link to that discussion in the description.

> Thanks! In general, if a PR was inspired by a Zulip discussion, it's always a good idea to link to that discussion in the description.

I overlooked that from the instructions. Thank you for pointing it out. I updated the description of the PR to include it.

Thanks!

Could you include in the PR description an explanation of what you're working towards here? I don't think mathlib can justify having every OEIS sequence at this point, but if this is a step towards something else I think this is reasonable to add.
Thanks!
Thanks!

Thanks!

Could you include in the PR description an explanation of what you're working towards here? I don't think mathlib can justify having every OEIS sequence at this point, but if this is a step towards something else I think this is reasonable to add.

No need to use `omega` to prove `m < n` :)
```suggestion
  rw [sylvester_prod_finset_add_one,  mod_add_mod,
    dvd_iff_mod_eq_zero.mp (Finset.dvd_prod_of_mem _ <| Finset.mem_range.mpr h)]
```
Thank you! (Overkill to prove the hypothesis indeed  .) And very nice simplification `rw` vs. `simp`.

```suggestion
  rw [Coprime, Nat.gcd_rec, sylvester_mod_eq_one h, gcd_one_left]
```
Thank you!

```suggestion
rcases h.lt_or_lt with c | c
   exact sylvester_coprime_of_lt c
   exact (sylvester_coprime_of_lt c).symm
```
Thank you!
Could you include the names of the main results? (e.g., see `NumberTheory/Fermat` for the format)
Thank you. `NumberTheory/Fermat` is a great example to follow.

I don't think this needs to be multi-line.
```suggestion
/-- Sylvester sequence: https://oeis.org/A000058. -/
```

You can drop the `by` on these `rfl`-lemmas.
```suggestion
theorem sylvester_zero : sylvester 0 = 2 := rfl
```

```suggestion
    dvd_iff_mod_eq_zero.mp (Finset.dvd_prod_of_mem _ <| Finset.mem_range.mpr h)]
```
Oops, sorry. I missed applying that suggestion before.

This comment feels a little strange. I would either wrap the following theorems in a `section Coprimality` or use a docstring like
```
/-!
### Coprimality of Sylvester's sequence
-/
```
Thank you. I like the comment with the header. This was made in advance for adding the next section about the explicit formula. I updated the comment.

You don't need to import files from `Init` manually
```suggestion
```
That's good to know, thanks!

I think we'd prefer
```suggestion
theorem two_le_sylvester (n : ) : 2  sylvester n := by
```

I'm not sure if `sylvester` is a great name for this; https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Joseph_Sylvester has many things named after him, and it's not obvious to me that this is somehow most important.

`sylvesterSequence` would be ok, but maybe you or another reviewer have a better idea.
I agree that `sylvester` is too vague. `sylvesterSequence` looks good to me, if it agrees with Mathlib conventions. We are open to any other name from the reviewers, as well.

pullRequest.title: feat: add basic facts about Sylvester's sequence
